intro: Cylindropuntia bigelovii subsp. ciribe, commonly known as the ciribe cactus, is a species native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a spineless, columnar cactus with cylindrical stems that can grow up to several meters in height. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer, which are typically clustered at the ends of the stems. It has a succulent structure that allows it to store water, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its subspecific classification highlights its distinct morphological and ecological characteristics compared to other members of the Cylindropuntia genus.
